Uses of Class
geometry.planar.Direction

  • Packages that use Direction 
    Package Description
    board
    Contains classes describing items on a printed circuit board and the board itself.
    geometry.planar
    Contains general purpose 2-dimensional geometry classes.
    library
    Describes library objects of a printed circuit board such as padstacks and component packages.

      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  BigIntDirection
      Implements the abstract class Direction as a tuple of infinite precision integers.
      class  IntDirection
      Implements an abstract class Direction as an equivalence class of IntVector's.

      int Direction.compare_from(Direction p_1, Direction p_2)
      Returns 1, if the angle between p_1 and this direction is bigger the angle between p_2 and this direction, 0, if p_1 is equal to p_2, * and -1 otherwise.

      boolean Direction.equals(Direction p_other)
      Returns true, if p_ob is a Direction and this Direction and p_ob point into the same direction
      static Line Line.get_instance(Point p_a, Direction p_dir)
      create a directed line from an IntPoint and an IntDirection
      int TileShape.intersecting_border_line_no(Point p_from_point, Direction p_direction)

      Direction Direction.middle_approx(Direction p_other)
      calculates an approximation of the direction in the middle of this direction and p_other
      Signum Direction.projection(Direction p_other)
      The function returns Signum.POSITIVE, if the scalar product of of a vector representing this direction and a vector representing p_other is > 0, Signum.NEGATIVE, if the scalar product is < 0, and Signum.ZERO, if the scalar product is equal 0.
      IntPoint FloatPoint.round_to_the_left(Direction p_dir)
      Rounds this point, so that if this point is on the left side of any directed line with direction p_dir, the result point will also be on the left side.
      IntPoint FloatPoint.round_to_the_right(Direction p_dir)
      Rounds this point, so that if this point is on the right side of any directed line with direction p_dir, the result point will also be on the right side.
      Side Direction.side_of(Direction p_other)
      Let L be the line from the Zero Vector to p_other.get_vector().
